name: Belgian Golden Ale
description: Medium strength Belgian style golden ale. Light and crisp for evening summer drinking. Hopped with French Elixir hops to provide additional subtle orange flavor.
brewing_instructions: Heat 5.7 gallons of strike water to 161°F
Add 5.7 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to mash tun and confirm temperature of ~153°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping, heat 3.6 gallons of water to 170°F for lautering
Extract first runnings into boil kettle
Add 3.6 gallons water and vorlauf
Extract second runnings into boil kettle
Total wort volume should be 7.36 gallons (7.3 actual)
Bring water to a boil and wait for the hot break
Begin boil
At 0 minutes add 15 drops FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 0.75 oz Hallertau Middelfrüh hops
At 40 minutes, add 0.75 oz Elixir hops
At 40 minutes, add 1 lb candi syrup
At 50 minutes, add one tablet Whirlfloc
At 50 minutes, add 1/2 tsp of yeast nutrient
At 50 minutes, add 0.6 oz Hallertau Middelfrüh hops
At 60 minutes, chill the wort to approx. 68°F
Aerate with pure oxygen for 1 minute
Move to the primary fermenter (5.75 gal actual)
Pitch yeast
Ferment at 67°F for 7 days
Ferment at 72°F for 2 days
Ferment at 65°F for 2 days
Cold crash to 36°F for 7 days
Package and carbonate
starter_brewing_instructions: Add 3L of water to Ehrlenmeyer Flask
Add 6 oz Extra Light Dry Malt Extract
Add 2 drops FermCap to reduce foaming as needed
Allow yeast to multiply for 24 hours
